alert.note: Alert for Alameda (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 12 at 7:52PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding of Alameda Creek caused by excessive rainfall this morning has kept the creek in minor flood stage, though it is starting to recede. * WHERE...Alameda Creek near Niles in Alameda county. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 PM PDT, River gauges indicate the creek is still in minor flood stage from rain this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fremont, Union City, Newark and Sunol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
